page.title: 13LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS
page.content: THE LANDSCAPE IS ROLLING COUNTRYSIDE. THE HIGHEST HILLS ARE 230 METRES, LOWEST LAND 80 METRES ABOVE SEA LEVEL. THE VIEW IS RESTRICTED BY GENTLE HILLS BUT SKIRRID FAWR CAN BE SEEN TO THE NORTH, SKIRRID FACH TO THE WEST. THE AREA IS MAINLY AGRICULTURAL, TWO WOODS SKIRRID FACH (PINE) AND LLANDDEWI (MIXED) ARE IN THE AREA. THE FIELDS ARE SMALL BOUNDED BY MIXED HEDGEROWS (HAWTHORNE, BRAMBLES, HAZEL, HOLLY). THREE BROOKS FLOW THROUGH THE AREA SUPPLIED BY NUMEROUS SPRINGS. WINDING CART TRACKS WORN BY WEATHERING ARE NOW METALLED AND FORM SINGLE TRACK LANES BOUNDED BY HIGH HEDGES. TWO ELECTRIC PYLON SYSTEMS ZIGZAG ROUND THE HILLS. THERE ARE FARM HOUSES WITH BARNS AND OUTBUILDINGS. THERE ARE SCATTERED COTTAGES CLOSE TO THE LANES.
